intro: Verbascum solacolui, commonly known as the velvetleaf mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its fuzzy, woolly leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces tall, erect stems with yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Verbascum solacolui is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its anti-inflammatory and soothing effects.
